Why you may want it

Sometimes things on the screen are only supposed to move so much and then stay where they are. In a task I was working on a few months ago, we decided to do that for a score in the left sidebar of our results page that follows a long quiz. We wanted to draw users' focus to the score and keep it at the center of attention even while users were free to explore the rest of the page.

When the user scrolls down the score scrolls with the rest of the page until it reaches the bottom of our fixed header. It then stays there while the main content continues to scroll as the user scrolls. It also detaches itself from the fixed header when the user scrolls back up.
